Summary Industrial Engineering professional, proactive and innovative, results oriented with more than 16 years of experience on the supply chain field at a multinational corporation, dedicated to the development and manufacture of high technology products. Proven experience as project and supplier manager, equipment, facilities and infrastructure maintenance programs development and also a solution provider and consultant for complex technical problems. 
 
Top strengths: Structured, Organized, Responsible, Meticulous and Collaborative. 
 
Top 5 core competencies: Technical consultant, Management, Program Development, Equipment - Experiment Design and Networking. Industrial Engineering Honors & Awards Costa Rica Assembly and Test Capital Transition Phase 1 - Team Award Jorge Sanchez Alvarado - AT Logistics Integration Lead In appreciation to enable Intel to prepare, pack and send over 62 critical tools (more than 80 tons) in record time to Asia ATM factories. Your innovation, risk taking , "Can Do" attitude and overall commitment to excellence, reflect the best of Intel Culture. Costa Rica Logistics Special Recognition Jorge Sanchez Alvarado April 2012 For the successful closure of the Costa Rica Warehouse Racking Seismic Reinforcement Project. Project was completed with no safety incidents, zero customer impact, under budget and within the pre-established timeline. The project was also executed with very high quality standards providing and additional storage capacity to the RAW Materials Group.  Costa Rica Logistics Special Recognition Jorge Sanchez Alvarado August 2012 In recognition for your discipline and diligence in managing Logistics budget during Q1/Q2. You managed to run the Industrial Engineering Group services under strict expenditure procedures and controls. On top of that you were able to produce cost savings/ avoidances up to $56K during the same period. Customer Planning Logistics Group Bronze Award - Risk Taking Role Model Jorge Sanchez and Mauro Segura September 2013 Eduardo clearly reflects this value, in the way he manages his responsibilities and executes the projects assigned to him. He manages his suppliers to meet Intel's high standard of Code of Conduct, ensuring all policies are followed accordingly, not hiding issues but actually making them visible in order for them to be fix. He made accountable his peers and other areas in the organization to follow the rules and plans accordingly to support their needs, from projects, funding and timelines.
